title: Robert Burns Memorial, Stanley Park
text:
The Robert Burns Memorial is an outdoor memorial and statue of Scottish poet <a href="Robert%20Burns">Robert Burns</a>, located in <a href="Stanley%20Park">Stanley Park</a> in <a href="Vancouver">Vancouver</a>, <a href="British%20Columbia">British Columbia</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a>.
Description.
Located at the southern approach to the park near Coal Harbour, upon a tall light-coloured stone plinth, a standing Robert Burns facing the south towards the southern entrance. A plaque appears on the front with his name, followed clockwise of reliefs of scenes from his poems, <a href="To%20a%20Mountain%20Daisy">To a Mountain Daisy</a> (1786), <a href="The%20Cotter%27s%20Saturday%20Night">The Cotter's Saturday Night</a> (1785), and <a href="Tam%20o%27%20Shanter%20%28poem%29">Tam O'Shanter</a> (1790).
History.
The sculpture was dedicated on 25 August 1928, becoming the first statue erected in Vancouver.
